definition: to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]

sentences.english: Journalists are studying the minister's speech for pointers to the contents of next month's policy statement.
sentences.chinese: 记者们在研究部长讲话以揣摩下月施政报告中的动向。

sentences.english: You become a mind reader and a fortune teller.
sentences.chinese: 你变成了一个揣摩别人心思的人，一个算命先生。

sentences.english: West chicken, and ponder to the south.
But conjecture carefully, the ancient use chinese characters more precise.
sentences.chinese: 但是仔细揣摩，还是古人用字更确切。

sentences.english: I simply couldn't figure out his intention.
sentences.chinese: 我简直揣摩不透他的用意。

sentences.english: This is the key understanding when it comes to figuring out which foods are acidifying and which ones are alkalizing.
sentences.chinese: 这是关键认识的时候，揣摩其中食品和酸化哪些碱法。

sentences.english: Q. Is there an effective time-management technique you’ve developed?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾经揣摩出一项有效的时间管理技巧？

sentences.english: The wicked are waiting to destroy me, but I will ponder your statutes.
sentences.chinese: 恶人等待我，要灭绝我，我却要揣摩你的法度。

sentences.english: Surmising the heart is the basic principle of officialdom.
sentences.chinese: 揣摩上心是官场的基本原则。

definition: to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
